intro: Holosteum umbellatum f. glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth-holosteum, is a rare and striking plant characterized by its unique floral structure. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants, and is native to specific regions in Europe. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces umbel-like inflorescences with small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its smooth, hairless appearance in this form distinguishes it from other varieties of Holosteum. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
